name: tomato seedling production, in unheated greenhouse, for planting | tomato seedling, for planting | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14956/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 tomato seedling, under non-heated greenhouse.;Functional unit is one tomato seedling at nursery.;34000 seedlings per ha.year are considered.

This activity starts with the nursery producing seedlings

Included processes: peat moss use, end-of-life and distribution to seedling farm, irrigation and greenhouse infrastructure.
Excluding: fertilizers and pesticides application and transport from the nursery to the farm where the seedlings will be planted. 
This activity ends with seedlings exiting the nursery.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/013:Plant propagation/0130:Plant propagation

processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Data are based on the main production of strawberry seedlings in Italy. Technology: Plastic greenhouses, non-heated
For the transport of seedlings to tomato farm, 100 g per seedling is considered, including moisture and container (Stoessel et al. 2012).

flow.name: tomato seedling, for planting
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/013:Plant propagation/0130:Plant propagation

exchanges.description: Calculated value: 1 ha divided by 34000 seedlings per ha and by 26 (i.e. seedlings are transplanted after 2 weeks). Note: greenhouse dataset stands for 1 m2 used over 1 year

flow.name: greenhouse, plastic walls and roof
flow.category: F:Construction/41:Construction of buildings/410:Construction of buildings/4100:Construction of buildings

exchanges.description: Calculated value: 34000 seedlings per ha, transplanted after 2 weeks (i.e. 1/26 of a year)

flow.name: Transformation, to arable land, unspecified use

exchanges.description: Total water use for irrigation = 25.5 m3/ha, for 34'000 seedlings of tomato/ha (Manfredi et al. 2012); Irrigation efficiency: 90%

flow.name: Water
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Mass of peat for one seedling: 30 g/ seedling (Based on Stoessel et al. 2012); 2.3 seedling/m2 (Martinez-Blanco et al. 2011)
